full_summary:
#Notice of Proposed Procurement
## Title
TBIPS - (1) Application/Software Architect Level 3
## Reference Number
23-230275

## Notice Information
* Published on 2023-01-10
* Closing Date: 2023-01-25 (14:00)
* Solicitation Method: Competitive
* Applicable Trade Agreements: Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement, Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership, Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement, Canadian Free Trade Agreement, Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement, Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement, Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement, General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade
* Solicitation Language: English

## Contracting Entity
* Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development
* Address: 125 Sussex Dr, Ottawa, ON K1A 0G2
* Contact Person:
	+ Name: Betty Woodman
	+ Phone: 343-203-6922
	+ Email: [betty.woodman@international.gc.ca](mailto:betty.woodman@international.gc.ca)

## Service Requirements
* Task-Based Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS)
* Level of Effort: 120 days
* Contract Duration: 12 months with 2 possible 12-month option periods
* Date of Commencement: 2023-02-27
* Estimated Date of Delivery: 2024-02-26

## Description of the Work
The Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD) requires the services of one (1) Application/Software Architect (Level 3) to assist and support the design, development, configuration, and testing of its External Access Management (EAM) application.

## Security Requirements
* The contractor must demonstrate at least a Secret clearance level

## Evaluation Criteria
The evaluation shall be based on the following criteria:
1. Technical capabilities and experience in delivering the required services.
2. Service level and performance
3. Compliance with security requirements

## Access to Documents and Information
The electronic document can be found in the realm of the GoC’s buyandsell.gc.ca only. The documents will be distributed directly from the contracting authority to the selected bidders. Pursuant to the terms of the Agreement the
